Reviews.Title: “Just not up to par....”
Reviews.Author: KKingtn
Reviews.Content: You know you are in trouble when the two people in front of you in the check-in line are already holding their keys. First man was checked into a room and walked in on a person in the restroom. OOPS...room occupied. Next man was checked into a room with no bed. AHH, minor detail. My room had been redone, but the work is really sloppy. It's like no one did quality control. I've stayed here before and it is a convenient location, but will not be back until construction is over. Parking is scarce, breakfast was not good and lack of staff makes this hotel not up to par. They need to seriously lower rates during construction. NOT worth the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Ever”
Reviews.Author: BobB1948
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in Bad state of repair, no parking for guest and total lack of respose for guest in bar and resturant. There is no staff to wait tables for business travelers and food is marginal

Reviews.Title: “Not responsive”
Reviews.Author: MoeKell
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for a week while I was attending training. I knew about the construction before I arrived and it really did not hinder my stay in any way. The room that I was in had not yet been renovated. It was clean but needed an upgrade. However, I noticed when I arrived that the clock in the bedroom had not been reset for daylight savings time. I asked to have it fixed (You need a screwdriver to open it up in order to change the time, so I could not do it myself). When I arrived back several hours later, the time had not been fixed so I called again and they finally sent someone up. However, the more important issue was the lock - or rather the lack of one. I happened to notice that the sliding door onto the outside balcony had no inside handle and no lock. Even though it was 2 stories up from the roof below, this was a little disconcerting since I am female and was staying alone. I reported it as I was leaving the hotel for my class and they said that they would have someone from enginerring look at it right away. When I arrived back late that night, nothing had been done. There was still no handle and still no lock. But it was late and I was tired so I waited until the next day to reported it again. They finally sent someone up and he screwed a small screw into the sliding side near where it meets the other one. So in theory the door could only be opened a few inches. However, this was a small screw and with any sort of strength, I'm sure someone could have been slammed it open and the screw would either fall out or snap off. I should have insisted that they move me to another room, but I didn't. It seems strange to me that I had 2 issues and both times it took 2 reports before they resolved the issues. In a service industry, the main concern should be keeping the customers happy. In this case, they totally failed.

Reviews.Title: “CONSTRUCTION!”
Reviews.Author: Jparker_12
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff really made the difference! They where awsome to our needs even offering late day check out which was a plus for us to sleep in a little. The hotel was under construction which was a negtative BUT they did make the effort to make the stay pleasurable. I arrived in mid day before my other guest and decieded to tak a nap and to my prevail it was impossible. It sounded like they where doing construction in the room above me. It was kind of noisy. The TV channels very limited. Overall the food was enjoyable and afforable as well as the complimentary "midday" drinks upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: jestevez25
Reviews.Content: the hotel was cheaper than similar ones in galleria. rooms remodeled but just kind of thrown together, things look like they were done by a bad handyman. rooms feel boxed in, little natural light, low ceiling, prison cell style. the atriu is nice and the breakfast was good too. pro: cheap, convenient, good food, good and cofortable working desk cons: bad neighborhood, dont get lost around there, stay on the expressway. away from restaurant area (about 10-15 minutes) bottom line: if you are in a budget this may be better, if you cna spend a little extra stay in the galleria area.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Nice”
Reviews.Author: VAfrog
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites resembles many others - the large atrium with fountains, rooms open to atrium. The staff was very friendly, the rooms clean and large, the breakfast good as always, happy hour okay - I've had better munchies at other Embassy Suites. Lots of mirrors, lights. It's not really near anything in particular, unless you are needing to be close to the hospital district. But it is very convenient for getting on the highway to go in any direction. We were about 5 minutes from the historic West End with the JFK Memorial/6th Floor Museum. It served our purpose to be close to an office, but also en route to some sightseeing. They are in the process of renovating some of the rooms - appears to be floor by floor. Nice to see the updating.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: jmrws1
Reviews.Content: I was surprised at how much i enjoyed my stay at this Embassy Suites. The particular hotel is older that most i have stayed in, but the staff has done an excellent job of modernizing the property. I stayed in one of the newly refurbished rooms and it was great. Diana at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. Every hotel should have at least one front desk clerk like her. overall i had a pleasant stay. Highly recommended for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Fashioncory
Reviews.Content: This hotel had all the amenities and was very clean. The only downfall is it is not near a cool neighborhood. The hotel however, had shuttles to many area locations. They were also very accommodating for evening plans. They were to sure to arrange one of their shuttles or a taxi. Free happy hour was a plus. Also free shuttle from airport.

Reviews.Title: “God amenities, less than good neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: JFCrow45
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel due to proximity to office I was visiting. There is not much in walking distance, which wasn't important to me. Staff was courteous, rooms were clean...no complaints! Had to drive a bit for good dining options, but would stay again for business.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: OKC5
Reviews.Content: This used to be my favorite hotel to stay at for business at market center but will have to re-think future trips. All I heard was excuses of "we are under new management" and things will get better. Things needed to be better for my stay at that time, not in the future. Rooms are way overpriced now and are expected to increase. Restaurant was far understaffed for the amount of customers expected. New menu is horrible and over priced compared to the past. All the friendly staff is gone and the front desk clerks were not responsive to complaints from myself and other guests. No response from emails to manager as well. If improvements to room and restaurant are made I am sure the cost will far outway the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Hold off on this one til they remodel”
Reviews.Author: TravelPrincess69
Reviews.Content: Ok, I read all the negative reviews, but it did not stop me from booking. Bad move on my part. Here's what I experienced in my room: stopped bathroom sink, tub very slow to drain, filthy carpet, paint peeling off bathroom door, drippy faucet, pipe leaking under sink, a/c with no temperature control -- my room vacillated from 72 to 80 at all times, ok breakfast, manager reception had a surly female table busser, mediocre assortment of appetizers, intense mildew smell in main lobby (lots of overgrown vegetation and a fountain that would look good in old world Italy 100 years ago) -- the smell is a bit much when trying to enjoy breakfast. Did I report this? Yes, to the smiling young desk clerk the morning of my 2nd day. I had printed out a nicely worded list of the items above that actually could have gotten addressed. His reply: Well, we will be undergoing a huge renovation this year. (sigh on my part -- what about us who are staying here right now?) "Well, we're getting the big screen TV's in now!" -- I'll sacrifice a flat screen TV for a clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Dismal and abysmal to speak cordially”
Reviews.Author: HPTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: Rooms are awful. My socks were dirty every night when walking around. Staff is exceptional, very helpful at Front Desk, but breakfast isn't worth the wait, manager reception is chips and hummus every night, nothing else....breakfast pastries are frozen. How can you charge these rates for the level of room you have. The property is old and dirty. Beds are so bad you can feel the wire substructure. A/C NEVER shuts off. Drapes are torn, bath tub stained. TVs are old fashion tube teles and pictures are not what you would expect. Very unhappy. What happened to 100% satisfaction? To speak with the manager feels like talking to a wall. "I'm sorry" gets old and unbelievable after being said for every concern esp. when you don't express any true sincerity. Your hotel wasted my time and money.

Reviews.Title: “Older rooms but ok. I like that all 5 of us can fit comfortably.”
Reviews.Author: lsutdw
Reviews.Content: This ES seems a bit old but it was pretty clean. The ventilation did not work in our suite. The bedroom had heat but the living room was freezing. My poor brother froze on an already cold night. Staff was nice and my dad enjoyed the breakfast. Close to the basketball stadium if you are going to a game. The bathroom was not too small but not large. There is a sink in the bathroom and the bedroom which is good if you have a large family. The tv was horrible. There were fewer than 20 stations and some numbers were skipped! Overall, I would stay here for a night or two if I didn't plan on being in the room much. The vending machine took our money but the hotel "couldn't" refund it. I thought that was poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing at best”
Reviews.Author: Jeffy492
Reviews.Content: The hotel is adjacent to 14 lanes of I-35E and it's frontage roads. Traffic noise is non-stop and annoying. We asked for a room away from the highway at check in but our request could not be honored. No reason was given. All staff at the hotel were friendly, helpful, and appeared to be hard working. It seemed to me that there simply needed to be more of them. It is apparent that this hotel is running with the minimum number of employees needed to keep the doors open. I found myself wishing for a self serve breakfast buffet while I stood in line at 6:00 AM waiting on my 'cook to order' breakfast. After standing in line for 15 minutes I can assure you it was not worth the waiting time. The pool is heated. The pool area is nice. The algae growing on the bottom of the pool kept me from actually using it. Too bad. Perhaps the Hilton corporation could afford to hire someone to maintain it? We picked this hotel based on it's proximity to downtown Dallas (4 mi.) and our perception of the Embassy Suites brand. Clearly, our perception of that brand has changed after staying at this property. The staff was the only bright spot in an otherwise dismal stay. That is the reason for the rating of 2 instead of 1.

Reviews.Title: “Review of 11/11 - 11/14 stay”
Reviews.Author: Ken123456
Reviews.Content: - ATM broke for most of the weekend. - Breakfast service really slow. - Both doors leading to bathroom were screwed up to the point where they could not be closed quietly. - Ice machine broken on our floor the entire stay. - Happy Hour service was slow(did not utilize this, but always noticed the lines). - Had to call Housekeeping to get a hair dryer. - Room still outfitted with tube tv's. channel selection is limited. If you are planning on staying here specifically because of the free breakfast and happy hour, I'd keep looking instead.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Dallas for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Tiffani D
Reviews.Content: I went here for my bachelorette party and rented a 2 Bed 2 Bath Suite. It was amazing. They have a shuttle service to take you within 5 miles of the hotel and also they have a wonderful breakfast selection and a managers reception.

Reviews.Title: “run down, not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa L
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at my fair share of hotels in all price ranges and this one is definately over priced. The room was very dated, furniture was in poor/beat-up shape. Wall paper in bathroom was peeling, door looked like it had water damage, swollen and didn't want to close right. rust around the edges of the tub and floor. living room area furniture was dirty and abused heavily. Asked if there was a restaraunt onsite or somewhere to have drinks in the evening, but had nothing available. Front desk suggested mexican place next door (the Alamo), walked over only to discover it was turned into a dance club after 9pm and it was not a very inviting atmosphere. After heading to bed for the night we were awakened at 2am by loud banging which sounded like construction in a neighboring room, and at 3:30am awakened by a small child screaming and crying. We requested a wakeup call for 8:30 which we received at 7am. Breakfast smelled good but there wasn't much left to choose from once we arrived at 8am to eat, juices were gone, no water, only soda or coffee to drink. Needless to say will not stay at this location ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience - Good Location at Medical Center”
Reviews.Author: Jack2148
Reviews.Content: We had a good experience this week as I had my company stay here while doing business in the medical center of Dallas. The parking lot had an all night security guard that made us feel better. The rooms were older and needed some updating, but the beds & bedding were very nice. Rooms were clean. Breakfast was better than average. We would stay here again for sure. We even took advantage of the very nice clean pool and hot tub one night to relax from a hard day at work.

Reviews.Title: “Average Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: djmmlm4
Reviews.Content: Decent place for the money. Breakfast was very crowded for a weekend. Took an hour to get an omelet. Line was looooonnnngggg. Place could use an update but still decent value.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Embassy Stay”
Reviews.Author: willyray66
Reviews.Content: I just recently completed a weekend stay at this location while visiting friends in the Dallas area.I have stayed at other Embassy Suites , as well as this location, before and i have never been disappointed. This was the case with my stay this time, as service was top notch. Every single hotel employee that i encountered was extremely helpful and friendly. It is true that the hotel is a bit outdated in terms of decor and furnishings, as there were some small stains on the carpet and some of the furniture was a bit worn. But, in my opinion, this did not take away from the other positives i enjoyed during my stay. The lobby is well decorated and very inviting when you first walk in. Check in was quick and professional and i was even recognized by name as a Hilton Honors member. Room was very spacious and clean, bed was quite comfortable and bedding was clean .Bathroom was also very clean with Crabtree and Evelyn soaps, lotions and shampoos. Maid service was also great as my room was perfectly cleaned and restocked each day. The free breakfast was a nice touch to start the morning as well as the managers reception to top off the evening.This location may not be as modern and contemporary as other Embassy Suites, but if you are looking for a clean,, friendly,convenient hotel with great service then you cant go wrong. I will definitely return on my next trip to Dallas and suggest this hotel to all my friends and family. Thank you Embassy for another great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Embassy Suites we are use toooooo....”
Reviews.Author: ou1forthat
Reviews.Content: Outdated and not maintained to say the least..... This hotel has not be updated in at least 10years and I am being nice at that. Meet family there from LA and MO to have a little weekend get together. Made me look like I didn't do my homework.. which I didn't and that was my fault. There were a number of items that I noticed that were either dirty (walls/doors), stained (carpet) or torn (couch cushions). I asked for more bedding and the blankets had holes in them. I will pass on this Embassy Suites when in Dallas next time. Plus there was some band playing or some sort of music playing until midnight that rang thru the hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “Nice big clean room but whole property could use an update.”
Reviews.Author: marett
Reviews.Content: Service was friendly and property was clean it just needs some updating.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Kambrie
Reviews.Content: We had reservations for two nights, but showed up a day ahead of schedule, on OU/TX weekend!!! Unbelievably we were able to get in a day early. Thumbs up for that!!! Our room was okay, a little worn looking, but still okay. The first morning we were there I woke up to some sort of VERY boring lecture (in a foreign language) at 7:30 AM! The sound was coming through the air vents in the suite and could be heard wherever you went. It was especially loud and annoying in the bathroom. After an hour and a half ( the voice never stopped except to take a breath) I called down to the desk. After another 15 minutes the lecture finally stopped. Our room was on the second floor with the conference rooms below us. I think the sound was coming from there. Beware. The hotel lobby is nice. There is a pool and a fitness center. A complimentary breakfast is available along with a manager's happy hour in the evening. Nice touches. Over all, we enjoyed our stay. The hotel is pretty centrally located in Dallas with easy on/off access to the highway. This hotel is definitely in consideration for next year's OU/TX trip to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “The grumpy omlette guy is still there”
Reviews.Author: Gertilda M
Reviews.Content: This was a company trip and I was limited in where I could book, but I read the reviews before travelling to see what I was in for. Several mentioned the grumpy omlette guy. I didn't run into him personally but two of my fellow coworkers did! Otherwise breakfast was excellent. Room was ok. The door looked a bit flimsy, didn't seem to sit fully into the frame and the security bar was on crooked. Faint smell of leftover cigarette smoke. All in all, about what I would expect for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Great”
Reviews.Author: eckhoffm
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on a number of occasions and will definately be back. The service is always great and the rooms are always clean and quite. The happy hour service is an added bonus which makes myself and my business partners continue to want to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel...Breakfast was a disaster”
Reviews.Author: GoingIntoTheWorld
Reviews.Content: All Embassy Suites are nice. While this is the old style (atrium in the center), and it can be sort of noisy, especially in the mornings when breakfast is being prepared. The echoing sound flows up into the rooms (we were on the top floor). In this particular hotel, the breakfast smell filled my room (again I was on the top floor) starting at 7am. Sort of gross. But the biggest issue here was the hotel was full my night and the line for breakfast was about 1/2 hour long. They were obviously not prepared for a huge crowd. But still, I would stay here again. The rooms are nice, the beds comfortable. And this property has easy access to all Dallas has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Bulldoze and rebuild”
Reviews.Author: Happyhubby&Daddy
Reviews.Content: This property is sub-par for an ES. The hotel really could benefit from a facelift or at least some botox injections. The carpets are worn and the the doors are badly chipped. I would expect this level of decor at a Holiday Inn..not an Embassy. The breakfast is fair at best. The line was really long and the guy cooking (one guy mind you with a line of at least 18 people)...says "next" while never turning around. He will cook four omelets four at a time....put them on the plate.....and take the next four orders. Once he does this..and puts the omelets on the grill...THEN HE ASKS THE PREVIOUS FOUR OMLET TAKERS IF THEY WANT BACON - POTATOES OR SAUSAGE? How about completing the order first? I am sure the guy (who was sweating profusely) was cooking on his own time. Here is a hint ES Staff - smile at the guests....tell them good morning..it won't change the temperature of the cold potatoes they serve at breakfast, but it may make them go down easier. This hotel just feels dirty, and the awful showers do not help get that feeling off. The elevators works well.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: mneuman8201
Reviews.Content: I stayed here July 26-30, 2011. The rooms are nice, and very clean. The beds and the pillows are comfortable as well. The oatmeal and the yogurt.granola/fruit selection was delicious! Also, the elevators always moved quickly, and there was never a long wait. That's where my compliments end. The front desk staff was rude and dismissive more then once. The night before check out I spoke with the front desk and they assured me that there would be a final bill under my door in the morning (I had already given them my credit card for speedy checkout). There was NOT a bill in the morning, and when I went to the front desk to ask for one they had charged me 75 dollars too much! There was also a strange gift shop charge on my bill for $0.43?!?! How is that even possible? Nothing cost less then a dollar in there! It took from Saturday until Tuesday for the money to be refunded back into my account. My last night there was a fire scar with light and sirens (it happens), and there was no staff members instructing us where to go or what to do! The stairway was a heard of rushing people, that seemed very dangerous. It turned out to be burnt pop-corn on the 8th floor, so everyone was alright. My only complaint about the room is that the phone in EITHER of my two rooms didn't work, and we let them know the first night to no avail. The breakfast was the same everyday, and not good at all. The eggs were slimy and the biscuits were hard. Good luck staying here if good service is what you expect.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Embassy Suites standards”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug7900
Reviews.Content: We tried to stay here for a weekend in July 2011 with our two young kids, but ended up checking out and going to a different hotel. As someone who has stayed at Embassy Suites across the country, I was really dissapointed with the quality of this property. We chose this particular property based on it's proximity to the zoo and the indoor pool. We checked out for the following reasons: the indoor pool was filthy, you could clearly see a dirt trail from where the water came into the pool, down the wall, and all along the bottom. The area around the pool felt dirty and seemed to be mildewed. The hotel has a very dated appearance on the outside and feels like it could use a major overhaul on the inside as well. The carpets in our room were dirty and had a cigarette burn. The tv's and furnishings are ancient. The food at breakfast was well below Embassy standards - the potatoes were hardly cooked, pancakes and eggs tasted weird and were not replenished frequently. We chose to stay at the Hilton Anatole and ended up paying less even after paying for parking and adding in the breakfast buffet. The Anatole is an amzing property and it's just right down the street. My experience at this Embassy property has taught to do more research on where I choose to stay and not rely on the brand name.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but not the best kept embassy suites”
Reviews.Author: shinybright
Reviews.Content: Walking in, it had the familiar Embassy Suites chlorine-slash-food smell, which reminded me of stays at ES when I was little. The hotel is alright, but could use a little spiffing up. My parent's first room was supposed to be a non-smoking and its last user had obviously ignored the signs. The staff was quick, attentive and accommodating and they were in a new room in less than 15 minutes. I was happy that from our room, we didn't hear any noise from outside or downstairs in the main meeting/breakfast area. No major complaints, especially since the price was hard to beat!

Reviews.Title: “Needs re-branding”
Reviews.Author: sammowhammo
Reviews.Content: It's had to understand how this hotel remains branded as an Embassy Suites, poor old hotel, it's been beaten abused & neglected. The carpet is stained, rippled and worn. The rooms are in need of a total repainting. The room was either freezing or sweltering and that doesn't make for a restful night - the solution is to put a towel over the vent so it doesn't blow on you. There was a live roach crawling on the wall in the omlette prep area - we saw that on our last day. eeeew! super gross given that we had all eaten there for 2 days prior and also eaten in their cafe. And one of the 4 elevators was "out of service for painting" apparently that takes a very long time. The computer system broke down when we all went to check-out so no one was able to get a bill - let's hope there are no surprises on my bank card since I was never emailed one like promised. On the upside - the staff was great. Very cordial and apologetic about any problems our group encountered. Someone from the Hilton Brand needs to evaluate the condition of this property

Reviews.Title: “Far from the quality I love and expect at other Embassy Suites hotels”
Reviews.Author: brytonhiatt
Reviews.Content: Someone needs to remove the Embassy Suites sign from the front of this hotel. If this were a discount chain I would understand the lack of service and quality, but not an Embassy Suites. The entire building is old and it shows. One of the four elevators is broken (and in nine days I never saw anyone working on it), and another one worked only occasionally. The carpets are all worn, the TVs are old and only have roughly fifteen channels, and the locks on one of my bathroom's door didn't work. If you need to use the internet here, best of luck to you! If you pay for WiFi, it works sometimes in the lobby but rarely in a room, and the businesses center's two computers are slower than dial up and time you out after ten minutes. At one point, I came back to my room after a long day to find a giant wet spot in the middle of the floor. After calling the front desk, they eventually sent a service man. His solution to the problem? Using all my clean towels to dry up the mystery water on the floor overnight and not replacing them. Speaking of the front desk, the service is terrible. When your phone does work, good luck getting them to ever pick up. If you do happen to get through and ask for a wake up call, your chance of actually getting one is only 50%. Some of the employees at the front desk are very rude. Don't eat at the in-house restaurant, Pollo Rose. The servers are slow and the food sub par and overpriced. Since the nearest DART stop is inaccessible (across an eight lane highway), you have to use the shuttle service to get anywhere if you don't have a car. If you do, make sure you ask for the driver named Darnell! He is ultra courteous, timely, and will go far out of his way to help you out. Additionally, the man who works at the breakfast station making cooked-to-order omelets is quick and entertaining. Even on a busy weekend in the mid-morning, I never had to wait in line more than five minutes. Overall, I think you can find better service for what you will pay. But if you do stay here, make sure you lower your expectations (especially if you've stayed in any other Embassy Suites).

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating”
Reviews.Author: comadrecarreon
Reviews.Content: All i have to say is - dirty torn carpet, torn sofa, paint peeling from ceiling in bathroom, majorly scratched furniture. And non working elevator for 2 days with no posted signs....Room 417. And super terified when i noticed sliding door opened to balcony with no lock....yikes with my 2 year old twins!

Reviews.Title: “Room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: arualpalm
Reviews.Content: Things I liked about this hotel: 1. Nice bedding and towels. 2. Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries, when left in room. 3. Pleasant demeanor of staff. 4. Decent exercise facilities and warm pool water. Things needing improvement: 1. Sleep quality. If you stay here, expect to hear the constant rattle of the freeway and the televisions on either side of your room. Even if you move to the couch, you can expect to hear noise from the atrium. I do not think the noise from the other rooms was excessively loud, rather the noise was due to thin walls. 2. Connection to guest services/front desk from room. On four different occasions, I tried to phone guest services from my bedroom. Other colleagues tried to phone guest services as well, and no one ever picked up. We learned to walk to the front desk to ask our question. Even then, guest services did not always follow through. One evening at about 6pm, I walked to the front desk to ask for an extra blanket and lotion (as the maid never left any in my room until the last day I was there); the person at the front desk gave me some lotion and told me the blanket would be sent shortly. I waited two hours, but the blanket never arrived. 3. Rooms. My room looked like it was damaged from a boy band party. The bathroom door was clawed at the base, there were multiple stains on the carpet, and some of the furniture was dented. Old florescent lighting overhead. 4. Shuttle. Make sure you reserve the shuttle well in advance; otherwise, you may need to arrange a taxi or will have to wait a long time. 5. Business center has sloooow computers, and if you wish to access the internet from your room, prepare to pay $10/day. 6. Restaurant menus - greasy food. Not many healthy options. You can probably find better, healthier options at Whataburger or Subway, which are within walking distance. I have stayed in the Market Center district on other occasions and can recommend better hotels within a two-mile radius. I know people love the free breakfast and happy hour (well, if you are really into bacon or like a margarita served in a plastic cup) at Embassy Suites, but I would rather pay for breakfast and get good sleep at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Grotshops
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a suite on the ninth floor. The room was comfortable, but in need of updating (stained carpet, dated furnishings). Other than that, I have only positive comments about the hotel. Service was friendly and very good, despite the fact that the hotel was very busy with several large groups. I would rate the Embassy Suites-Love Field a little higher than this property, but if you need to be closer to downtown Dallas, this hotel is a perfectly good choice.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Bogyfre
Reviews.Content: There are many hotels to choose from in Dallas but nobody takes care of you like the Embassy Suites. From the great food, clean rooms, friendly staff, they are conveniently located and their prices fit every budget. Whether I am in town for business or vacationing with the family we always stay with my friends at the Embassy Suites.....

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in useful location”
Reviews.Author: blakester49
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed 2 nights here March 13-15. At the time this was the least expensive Embassy Suites hotel we could find in the Dallas area ($119 +tax). It is an average Embassy Suites hotel; older, dated, but OK. The front desk staff service was good and the food and bar experience average. The room had some issues. Some other reviews have commented on the freeway noise level if the room is on the front of the hotel facing I35. Our room was on the west side of the hotel and the freeway noise was very noticeable in the bedroom even though we werenâ€™t directly facing the freeway. The noise was loud because the balcony sliding glass doors leak air. The doors were permanently locked sometime in the past and canâ€™t be opened. There was a significant breeze coming from between the 2 doors and more important than the freeway noise was the cold outside air! If the doors are pressed together by hand the cold air AND the freeway noises are greatly reduced. The thermostat does not have a temperature setting. If you find the temperature cold or hot you move the dial up or down. Our main reason for seeking an Embassy Suites hotel was the indoor pool for our kids. The pool was average Embassy Suites style and packed with kids. There were only 3 tables with chairs. The kids said the pool was warm the first day and cold the second. The thermostat on the wall indicated 79 the first day and 73 the second. The colder air temperature made the overwhelming chlorine smell more tolerable on the second day. This was an OK place but I would not seek it out in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bkperrine
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this property. Convenient location, conducive for a business stay. Clean rooms, quiet, with the extra space of the suite concept highly useful. I also found the staff very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs.”
Reviews.Author: Carylumley
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites MC offered everything we needed for our large group. Great rooms with extra space for working, ammenities such as a mini fridge added an extra convience. The breakfast was a great start to each day, and the managers reception was a perfect ending to a long day. The location was close to downtown Dallas, big plus for us! I would recommend the Embassy Suites MC for anyone traveling in Dallas, TX.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome property & staff!”
Reviews.Author: R0adWarri0rPrincess
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Embassy on numerous occasions and have always had excellent experiences. Their customer service is outstanding. As a frequent traveler, I can tell you that this is not always the case. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent catering service!”
Reviews.Author: Betty1827
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a "just right" place to hold a special, personal event, I highly recommend the catering services and staff of this hotel venue. I didn't stay overnight, but I did have a family member who did, and they stated the room was just fine. The location is great. The ballroom space was comfortable and the set-up was lovely. The menu offers a good variety of food (I chose buffett style) and their prices are reasonable. You won't find a better place than this one in the area and for the value of your money. Ask for Brittany Davenport - she is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Home Sweet Home”
Reviews.Author: Tbolin
Reviews.Content: Over the last 6-7 years I have travelled quite often in the continental US. I have been a Hilto Honors Member for that period of time as well and this Hotel has by far exceeded my expectations. From the moment you enter the door and are welcomed with a smile and hello, to the recognition by name that you are a Hilton Honors Member, the stay is great. The rooms are always clean and smell fresh. There is a welcome treat for me which is always nice after a long day. The food at the Polo Cafe is fantastic and always deliveredquickly and correct. The housekeeping staff does a great job as does all the staff I have dealt with. Of all the locations in Dallas that are available for Hilton customers I will always stay at this location. It is always a great experience as if I were at my own home.

Reviews.Title: “I love your hotel and your staff!”
Reviews.Author: nsdkirkbride
Reviews.Content: I am with Mary Kay Cosmetics, a National Sales Director. I have chosen YOUR hotel for the past 20+ years. I bring a hundred plus with me yearly. We love your service. Your "family" atmosphere. From the bellman, to the desk clerk to your manager. I think her name is Jennifer Baker. She is who I have dealt with for the last few years, and i pray she never leaves. I say this because with all of the years I have been coming there, I have seen many changes, with Banquet managers too. Jennifer does the" and then some" to make our stay perfect. We love your hotel. Thanks for allowing me to inform you of this. Linda Kirkbride

Reviews.Title: “"Great experience - beautiful atmosphere!"”
Reviews.Author: dfw5
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time! The atrium was just beautiful & the amenities were very good too! Very yummy breakfast in the morning that is included with your room. I would like to see this hotel do some renovating though...just some more modern updates (ie: flat screen TV's, paint, furniture.) Overall, our stay was very pleasant & I was surprised how quiet it was with all the rooms facing the atrium area!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel....Love the Staff”
Reviews.Author: jeoflahert
Reviews.Content: This is the best Embassy Suites that I have stayed at. The staff treats the guest like they are family.

Reviews.Title: “Review of Dallad market Center”
Reviews.Author: KAM3407
Reviews.Content: Excellent. Jennifer baker and staff always make me feel very welcome and special. They are glad we are there

Reviews.Title: “The Embassy Suites was a perfect host for our business trip.”
Reviews.Author: J_Balthazar
Reviews.Content: Our organization hosted a conference and the Embassy Suites was a great venue. The sales staff assisted us in coordinating with all the attendees arriving from various cities. They also provided a great conference room for our meetings and was very accomodating with numerous last-minute changes to our schedule. All the personnel were very friendly and helpful. If you are doing business in the downtown Dallas area, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Women's Ministry Conference Trip a Success”
Reviews.Author: cynsellsavon
Reviews.Content: Our Women's Ministry traveled to Dallas in Oct.,2010 for a conference and stayed at this hotel. Our ladies were all pleased with their suites. Although we were away from the hotel most of the day, we returned to a comfortable nights' rest. The breakfast buffet was a mega hit! Everything was well prepared and very delicious. The service was great and everyone we encountered at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. The only negative feedback I received from a couple of ladies is lack of towel racks in the bathroom and handicap bars to assist the older ladies in and out of the bathtub. We would definitely consider staying here again for upcoming conferences.

Reviews.Title: “ALWAYS TREATED WITH RESPECT.”
Reviews.Author: 123pinnacle
Reviews.Content: I make the trip to Dallas every 3 months with my wife. Have stayed all over Stemmons Freeway before. Found the Embassy Suites and tried it once. Have been staying there ever since. Nice, clean, friendly atmosphere. Breakfast is great. The evening managers gathering is a great place to unwind. Not looking for any other place to stay now. Very satisfied with the Embassy Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Get-a-way”
Reviews.Author: ballaa1115
Reviews.Content: I love this property. It's close to everything we wanted to do like visiting the cultural arts center. I loved the rooms because it had space for our boys to play and set up their computers for games. The food was excellent and the staff was very nice and helpful with directions.

Reviews.Title: “Our saving grace”
Reviews.Author: Stephtastic
Reviews.Content: The girls and I had planned a trip to Dallas to see a Dallas Maverick's game. We booked a hotel room at La Quinta, we got there and it was GHETTO!!! We didn't feel safe staying there so we drove over to another hotel, which was also ghetto. We saw this Embassy Suites on our search for a better hotel. We found this hotel and it was fantastic. I feel I definitely got my money's worth. Everything was clean, we felt extremely safe, they have a complimentary happy hour which was much needed after the stressful trip. The staff was excellent. The made to order breakfast was awesome as well, plenty of choices. We spent about $75 more here than we would have at La Quinta, but we got every pennies' worth. And it was only about 2 and 1/2 miles from the American Airlines Center. If you are a light sleeper request a room towards the back of the building, our room faced the freeway and it was a little noisy but it wasn't a problem for us.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: hounds20
Reviews.Content: We almost always stay at a Hampton Inn or Embassy Suites and are use to receiving a clean room. However this hotel is dirty. Stained carpet, hair on bathroom floor, weevil in cereal, smelly towels, old mushy beds. Staff was good. Will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Run Down and Sad”
Reviews.Author: LauraQ427
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this particular Embassy Suites on many occasions as I have a yearly meeting in Dallas. Each year I visit, the hotel and the rooms get worse and worse. This time around is particularly bad. The couch in the living space is filthy with greasy head stains. The carpeting under the sink in the bedroom is soaked and smelly. The walls and wallpaper are filthy and bubbling in many areas. There is no power button on the TV - just a hole where it used to be. And I'm nervous of getting a fungus on my feet from the shower. It took me a good 15 minutes to check in because the woman behind the counter was busy flirting with the pizza delivery guy. The only positive so far was the woman in the gift shop who sold me some Advil. I'm very disappointed as I usually look forward to my stay at this property. Now I just can't wait to leave. Hotel Management - it is time to invest some money into the rooms - UPGRADE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Yet another good Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: SGates
Reviews.Content: As usual, another good Embassy Suites. Same basic things I've become used to, free happy hour, free breakfast, good business center. The bartender makes good mixed drinks and the breakfast is top notch. Easy to find with amenities near by.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: meanderbug
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely beautiful. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The breakfast was incredible as was the manager's reception. The check out was a mess. The front desk clerks could find no record of my stay or credit card information. I will have to wait until it posts to see if they charged me correctly. Also, when I came home, I was covered in bites. My doctor said it looked like bedbugs. The room was very clean, but they need to change the sleeper sofa and bed linens daily to ensure this doesn't happen again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do It!!”
Reviews.Author: getaway_girl39
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a departure from the quality I expect from Embassy Suites. I frequently stay at Embassy Suites but this hotel had very poor customer service, the room was outdated and unclean, the breakfast did not offer many of the items I expect from the breakfast menu at Embassy Suites, and most of all (like the other reviewers have noted) the area does not seem safe. The gated entrance gave me concern when I first saw it and a security person walked out of the lobby but did not look particularly concerned about patroling. I didn't feel as if the parking lot was safe at all. We had no option but to stay at this hotel because we booked it only minutes before our arrival at 2:30 a.m. and the hotel would have charged our card even if we declined the room. I will never stay at this hotel again and certainly encourage everyone else to avoid this pricey mess of a hotel! I will say that the night before we stayed at an EMBASSY SUITES in MEMPHIS (on S Shady Grove Road) which was EXCELLENT . . . after that experience at the Memphis Embassy Suites, the Embassy Suites Dallas Market Center was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: sugarlandok
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel and my SUV got broken into no one at the hotel cared or even helped me clean up the glass. Spoke with a manager Ms. Daniel who would not get anyone to assist me and told me it was basically my fault that this happened. As the other review stated several employees told me that this had also happen to them. Use caution when parking your vehicle at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL STAY EVER”
Reviews.Author: cvidrin
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel for over 20 years. What used to be an enjoyable stay has now turned into a deplorable one. The room was filthy. The service was---well, there was NO service to speak of. The entire staff, except for the Chef at breakfast and the lady who cleaned the tables, was passive. When the hotel managers don't care, how can we expect those beneath them to. This was my last stay at this Embassy. I would advise everyone to stay away, also!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware high car thief area”
Reviews.Author: Cent2012
Reviews.Content: The family suv was stolen from the hotel parking lot. After talking to staff members I discovered that car theft is common at this hotel. Two staff members told me their own cars were stolen from there while they were at work. There is a security bar at the entrance and exit that is totally use less. They have security cameras but the police will not have time to look at it. I wasn't offered anything but some preprinted paperwork for the hotels insurance purpose. There are signs in the parking lot stating the hotel is not responsible for theft of personal property. That should have been a sign for me to stay away.

Reviews.Title: “busy, busy, busy”
Reviews.Author: lotsatravelTulsa
Reviews.Content: off to bad start, 1st room came with a guest in the living room, the place was packed (it was spring break time) the staff kept up well with breakfast though if you know dallas or use a gps this hotel is in the middle of everything 15 minutes to alot of things in all directions. hot tub was luke warm at best. no free internet exept in business center (2 slow as can be computers)

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: ViajeraSanClemente
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel before and it's always been OK. What really bothers me is the freeway noise - you can't sleep at night. If you want a king bed, they all are on the sides of the hotel which are very noisy; the backside of the hotel has doubles only and this is the quietest area. The staff is very nice; it has a good restaurant and bar; free parking, nice (free) breakfast buffet. It is a bit dated and could use some sprucing up, but for the business traveler, I'd say it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience in along time”
Reviews.Author: Gotimone
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying the rooms are extremely dated and totally filthy. When I book here I figured it was an Embassy Suites and it would be a nice place. Having stayed in a couple of other Embassy Suites. I was traveling with my daughter and her husband so I decided to get a two bedroom suite so we could each have our own bedroom. I thought the AAA discounted room at $188.00 plus taxes was a good deal. Yea good deal if you dont mind staying in a room that the carpets look like they haven't been cleaned in 10 years. There was a stain on it (looked like red wine) but who knows.. That appeared to have NEVER been attended to. One of the bed coverings had blood stains on it.... yes you heard it right blood stains... Come on that is totally unnecessary. They do offer a complimentary cocktail hour, where you are asked to hold on to your PLASTIC cup if you want another drink... Needless to say we did not go to the also complimentary breakfast. I am not saying that I expect the room to look like I cleaned it, but really blood stains... Oh well I guess you never know what you are going to get., I am just trying to spare some other poor soul.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: BaseballMomTo22
Reviews.Content: The location is close to downtown. It is on the other side of the freeway and you cannot walk to the downtown area. The parking is free. The hotel is in dire need of a makeover. It looks old and smells old. The staff is uncaring and rude. I called down for a blanket and pillow and was told to come and get it myself since they were too busy. The breakfast was fine. The Manager's Reception consisted of pretzels and drinks. Kids were running all over the lobby and yelling at each other. The pool closed for cleaning on our second day which seemed like poor timing. The gym was very hot. Maybe the A/C wasn't working. The room layout was great, but the torn up bathroom door showed it's age. My bedside phone did not have a cord to connect it to the wall. We will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: friscocat
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a wedding over the Fourth of July holiday weekend. It has the standard Embassy Suites design, and the suites are spacious as with other Embassy Suites. The location is close to downtown, and parking is free. Each room also has a step-out balcony, and we had a nice view of downtown. The food at breakfast, the wedding reception, and from room service were all good. However, the hotel needs to be renovated. The rooms are showing their age and need to be refreshed. The exterior of the hotel could also use some work. The breakfast line was quite long. We had problems with our shower, but maintenance came right away. Housekeeping came very late in the day, but that could have been because of the holiday. Overall, it was not too bad. With a renovation and improvement of the breakfast set-up, it could be an ok hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites - Nice rooms, long lines for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: KKAustin
Reviews.Content: Overall I would say that this is a nice place to stay. If you are used to staying at the Embassy Suites, then this hotel shouldn't disappoint you. When I checked in I have to say that the front desk attendant was less than cheery. He got the job done though. My room was clean and ready for my stay. Overall it was clean and set up nicely. Unfortunately for me, I had to stay at this hotel during spring break so it was packed with kids. This means there was no way I could hit the pool or fitness center. The breakfast line was incredibly long in the mornings. Based upon what I saw, I don't think the hotel can handle very large groups in the breakfast area at one time. Overall, I got a great rate so I think I'd stay at this hotel again if I needed to be in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT hotel”
Reviews.Author: alfleenor
Reviews.Content: I am a business traveller and stay at this particular hotel at least 4 to 5 times a month! The front desk receptionist knew my name on my second visit and are always courteous, dining directors are great and so is the food, a great bartender for a great glass of wine and conversation! I could go on and on! We have had several conferences here as well. They had a powerpoint screen ready and the food was layed out perfectly. They accomodated all of our needs. I would highly recommend staying here for leisure or business!

Reviews.Title: “Problems with the breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: TX1969
Reviews.Content: In 2007 the Embassy Suites Market Center was my favorite hotel in Dallas. Last year everything from the check in, the room, happy hour and the breakfast was excellent. In mid November of 2008 the initial experience was good but the breakfast on Saturday morning really did not meet my expectations. At around 9:30 a.m. the buffet was picked apart with food items laying everywhere. The hotel management did not seem to care about the presentation and/or food safety. Being a Hilton HHonors Diamond member, I was sent a survey shortly after my stay. I completed the survey and asked for a response which I have not received to date. I still believe that the Embassy Suites Market Center Dallas is a good hotel but also that the hotel temporarily struggles with their restaurant management.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for family of four”
Reviews.Author: Dottybug
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites during the Thanksgiving holiday 2008. We decided to stay here because we knew they offer a complimentary breakfast and there would be a lot of room for the four of us to spread out. There were good and bad things about our stay, but overall it was fine for our purposes. And most of the bad things aren't so bad unless you are pretty picky. Bad things: 1) the carpet looked pretty dirty and was well worn down. However, my daughter walked around the room with white socks on and they didn't get pick up dirt so it was clean enough. It's just a bad first impression. 2) The cold water tap in the sink in the kitchenette area didn't work (hot water tap did work), but there are two other sinks in the room to use so that didn't bother us and we didn't call for someone to fix it. 3) The bathroom was small, but if you just needed a sink, there are two others in the room. 4) One problem they need to fix is that our bathroom had no towel bars. It seemed strange to me that they offer the "hang up the towels to conserve laundry waste" option, but don't have anyplace to hang them up. There is a hook behind the bathroom door, but it certainly wouldn't hold four towels. The shower curtain rod was fine for hanging up wet swimsuits - until someone wanted to take a shower. And because the rod curves out beyond the actual tub, anything that drips will drip on the floor. 5) The sofabed was thin (3-4" thick or so) and was uneven, but the way it opened up it was raised at the head, like a hospital bed. My children (ages 12 and 8) loved it because it was easier to watch t.v. that way. As for comfort, they had no complaints, but then they can sleep in airplane seats with no complaints either. I didn't even try it out because I have a bad hip, but I think for the kids it is a novelty. Adults might not think it too wonderful. 6) Our room was facing a major highway, IH-35. The noise from the traffic created some background noise. I'm a heavy sleeper so it didn't bother me, but if you need it silent you should ask for a room opposite the highway. 7) At the breakfast buffet, the glasses for beverages were dirty from the manager's reception the night before. The glass I grabbed had margarita salt and lipstick still on it. Use the styrofoam cups they provide. 8) I didn't see anyplace to grab a bite nearby except a Whataburger just north of the hotel. Except for breakfast we ate away from the hotel anyway. We did order Domino's pizza the first night and they delivered no problem. You could probably ask the front desk for other options, and there is also room service. Good things: 1) The room has lots of storage and lots of space. There is an armoir in the bedroom, shelves in each of the two t.v. cabinets, a shelf under the sink in the bathroom and the kitchenette. The room was a good size. Even with the sofabed open, there was room to move around without banging into furniture. 2) For our family of four, the complimentary breakfast was a huge convenience and what sold us on the hotel. Go early to avoid the long lines at the hot breakfast counter (omelets and pancakes). We went there at 7:30 and there were only 3 people in line in front of us. On another day we got there at 9am and the line had 12 people. But there are other things to eat if you don't want to wait: hot oatmeal with toppings you can add in; cereal (Total, Corn Flakes, Fruit Loops & Frosted Flakes) and milk; fresh fruit (whole apples and oranges, cubed cantaloupe and honeydew); pastries; rolls; bread for toast (wheat and white); yogurt; muffins; standard beverages like OJ, apple juice, and coffee. 3) Since the hotel is right off IH-35, it's easy to hop on the highway to get to where you need to go. We went sightseeing all around the city so it was a convenient starting point. 4) The kitchenette was a bonus for us. The fridge was small, but held all our Thanksgiving leftovers (Maggiano's was fabulous!)plus sodas and water. There is a small microwave and coffemaker with coffee and tea provided. The dining table in the room was a convenient place to eat, use the laptop, dump off our packages, and to sit and hang out together. We got our money's worth from this hotel and I would say even though the hotel could use some perking up, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was good - security guard was overbearing”
Reviews.Author: blc1975
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. This is the perfect thing when you are staying with more than one kid - parents can have a bed, child can have a bed and other child can have sofa bed. Not to mention three sinks, plenty of mirrors for getting dressed. The security guard was way overbearing on our children - who honestly (even though most parents think this) had done nothing wrong. He seemed so set on them doing nothing wrong that he followed them and hounded them AND ME about being in the elevators too much. (They had exited on the incorrect floor - instead of 1st floor saying 1 it had the G, so they got off on 2nd and then re-entered). I followed behind and he explained to me for several minutes why they didn't need to be on the elevator. Soured my experience a little. However, the front desk clerk was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was very clean - the bed was very comfortable, I can't say enough about the free breakfast! I understand he was doing his job and I'm glad that teens are not running out of control, but when a parent is with the kids I think he should have backed off a little. The hotel itself though was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: MBNick
Reviews.Content: This COULD be a very good hotel. While we were put in a room directly in front of a kitchen exhaust stack, we were not there for the view. The room was obviously newly rennovated. It was fairly clean. Some grout falling in the tight inner bath but did have 2 sinks. Outlet next to bedroom sink did not work, nor did the remote for the living room TV. Note to housekeepping was ignored for the entire time we were there. Never fixed. Breakfast was on a par with other good Embassy locations. Afternoon reception another story. Instead of Seagram's 7 they had Candian Club but no vermouth and they were not going to get any! Only white wine was Chardonnay even though popular variaties like Pinot Grigio would not cost them any more. Left and went to the reg. bar. Bartender was a bit weird and poured as little as possible, but was acceptable. Oddly the price for drinks was different each day. On Saturday an new bartender told my wife in seconds that they were out of Pinot Grigio!!! On the week-end??We left. Another customer walked in one night and bought a beer because they ran out of comp. Bud Lite and would not get anymore. Maybe that is part of their game plan? Happy hour also went from hot items to goldfish and salty crushed dog biscuits for the rest of week. If they wanted to be cheap pick something non salty to discourage drinking! We ate several dinners here. Sirloin special was good, mashed potatoes were very good. Broccoli tasted of freezer burn. Salads fresh but when I asked for a vinegarette dressing they brought me a little cup of what apparead to be balsamic vinegar! Elevators were good. Pool, exercize, and internet ok. Staff friendly but place is under staffed. Problem with leaving automated wake up call. Front desk said they would fix. We had a 7 am flight. Never got the wakeup. With a "little" customer orientated focus on details this would be a good place to stay, noting that it is a liitle bit farther away from most of the action in Dallas. My suggestion is that raise the rates $4. per night and do things right. I don't think we would stay here again unless they improve.

Reviews.Title: “Loud and uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: queenmomOK
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in a King Suite. The king bed was fine, but the pull out bed was on an incline and very uncomfortable. I asked for a roll away , but was told they don't have them. This hotel was very loud and it was impossible to sleep with all the noise. I am not being picky here. This hotel is one of the worst I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: BatonRouge-LoUiSiAna
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at Embassy Suites in Colorado Springs the week before and would not believe they were even the same hotel chain. The room was very musky, we asked to change rooms which they did with no problem but the next room was just as bad. They say they have just redone the rooms but in my opinon they hired very cheap labor. Very disappointed in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seebradgo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 10-5 thru 10-7. The hotel has been recently renovated and the room we stayed had been completely remodeled from last year. We stay at this hotel on a yearly for the Texas State Fair and the annual OU / Texas Football game. The bed was comfortable and the furniture in the room was all brand new. We stayed in a suite on the top floor and couldnâ€™t have been happier. The breakfast and omelet bar that is famous to Embassy Suites did not disappoint. The staff was very friendly and accommodating despite the hotel being completely full. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It is in a fairly central location located right off the I-35, but keeps you away from the crowded downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable and Practical”
Reviews.Author: arkansastraveler42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel to attend the Dallas Market and loved everything about it! The front desk was very accommodating and attentive to what we wanted. They first gave us a room with a king bed but we needed two doubles so they changed our room with a smile. The rooms were recently renovated and very attractive. Dark wood cabinets and granite countertops. There was a mirror and sink in the bedroom, bathroom and a wet bar with mirror in the separate living/dining area. This was particularly convenient for us because we had 3 ladies in our room so we each had a mirror and sink to get ready. I ended up sleeping on the sofa bed one night and it was actually pretty comfortable. The main thing about this hotel that appealed to us was the safety factor for this area of town. We felt very secure during our stay. If you are a smoker, the balconies are not accessible but there are smoking rooms available. If you don't want to stay in a smoking room, you can smoke in a small outdoor courtyard off of the pool area until 9:00 p.m. when the doors are locked. We also made good use of the free cocktails at the manager's reception and the free breakfast. Since we were in a hurry most mornings, we stuck to what was on the buffet which was pretty decent. On the last day I stood in line to get a cooked to order breakfast and it was better. Either way, it was free. The only real complaint we had was that the juice tasted funny so we drank water. Anyway, if you are staying in this part of town, I would highly recommend this hotel for its convenience and comfort factor.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what I expected”
Reviews.Author: hcs81m
Reviews.Content: I had an overnight stay at this hotel for a business trip in late March 2007. The Good: The room was spacious and had a great view of downtown Dallas, the staff was friendly, and the location was very convenient. The breakfast was excellent. The bad: This hotel is needs a facelift. The tub was old and stained and the furniture appeared old. The ugly: Loud construction noise started 9:00am. I returned to the hotel to take a shower and finish packing at 11:00am and discovered the water was turned off due to construction. (11:00 am to 4:00pm per the front desk) I called the front desk and advised them I needed to wash my hands after going to the bathroom, and bottled water was sent to my room. I was given a partial credit as compensation.

Reviews.Title: “Upside/Downside”
Reviews.Author: Megga-Traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Embassy Suites in Dallas at the Market Center. The only 2 things I have to complain about is the quality of food and when we first went in to the suite, I went straight to the bathroom and found urine all over the toilet seat. I did complain about that and the manager compensated for it (not a discount on room price but another way). However, I did sleep very well cause the beds are very comfortable but if I didn't have to get up by 8:00, I would have been very upset at the construction that started around 8:30. Heard lots of hammering around that time. A little inconvenience of having to go around the hotel to the other side to catch the elevator the next morning because we were on the 8th floor and the elevator was out of order for a short period of time (probably about an hour or so). Shuttle drivers were very nice and the girl at the front desk at check-in was very nice also.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Price but Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Reviewer20
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the ES Dallas Market Center this past week - the second time I've been there. I agree with the other reviewers - the hotel is definitely outdated. Not dirty or messy, but terribly outdated. The staff were friendly and helpful (front desk, gift shop, and meal area). There is a fitness center behind the pool area - has the standard treadmills, cycles, and nautilus machines. Didn't try the pool or hot tub, but like the rest of the hotel, they look pretty outdated. I didn't try the restaurant, but the breakfast area has the standard ES fare - it was good, and the staff were friendly. They had a check-in/out kiosk at the front desk - if you used it for either, you should get 500 HHonors points each time. Great idea - haven't gotten the points yet though. The kiosk was useful if there was a line waiting to check in, but it would have been faster to check in at the front desk than using the kiosk. Check out was pretty quick. The hotel is very convenient to downtown and Love Field, but there really isn't anything terribly close by except a Whataburger two buildings over. If you have a car and can drive everywhere, the location isn't too bad. If you need to get on the Tollway North - go up to Mockingbird and then over - otherwise you have to circle through downtown - yuck. All that said, it boils down to a lesson in economics - depending on the price, I'd stay here again. A rate in this area for under $100 is a pretty good deal, plus throw in the free breakfast and manager's reception - not too bad. Anything much over that, and I'd probably stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “High Speed Wireless is Neither!!”
Reviews.Author: MrsTexas
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a busines stay here. I probably will stay elsewhere next time. The front desk people were friendly and helpful, however the hi-speed wireless does not reach to the 9th floor! The speed was so slow it would not even open my email.When I called the front desk, they gave me an 800 # to call, which was useless.They should just tell people it doesn't reach to the higher floors. Rooms were tired.Both bath sinks completely filled with water and would not drain.One of the TV remotes did not work. The bathtub had a huge rust stain which kept me from wanting to take a bath.At $149 a night, I will definately say elsewhere next time. Housekeeping just comes barrelling in to your room without knocking. Room service was good, food was good, breakfast was good. Rooms badly need updating. The blue floral wallpaper in the bathroom looks hideous!

Reviews.Title: “Average Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: Jarle1989
Reviews.Content: This Embassy Suites was average (have stayed in better!). It is within 10 minutes to several good restaurants and is very convenient to Medieval Times. The beds weren't very comfortable and the I-35 traffic noise was a little much so it might be a good idea to ask for room on back side. Manager's Reception had great drink variety, but was disappointed with only popcorn and pretzels for snacks. Morning complimentary breakfast was good though - cooked to order eggs and plenty of extras. Staff wasn't extremely helpful, but hotel overall was clean and attractive. Parking can be a problem after 10 p.m.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Embassy Suites Market Center was over the Thanksgiving Holiday. The staff was very friendly. The price was great for what you get (free made to order breakfast and free Happy Hour). The room was big and comfortable. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “not up to embassy suites standards + poor front desk”
Reviews.Author: willbegone
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel one night on business and checked out in the morning due to my disappointment with the room and the way I was treated at the front desk. This is a very old style Embassy Suites and the rooms are tired and outdated. The location is directly on the freeway with no restaurants neaby. My room was very noisy due to road noise and I did not sleep well. I enquired at 7:30am the next morning if I could change to a room in the back but was told that the hotel was fully booked (I don't believe it given the parking lot). Anyway, they oould have offered to switch me to a room in the back later that day when something opened up or at least check their computer. Instead, they didn't offer anything. I asked to speak to the manager and the Hhonors manager but was told they were not in and unavailable. So, I told the front desk I'd be back in five minutes, went up to my room and threw everything in the suitcase and came back down to check out. I later called the Hhonors customer service to register my complaint and to their credit they removed the one night's room charge from my account.
